Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_53701
DisplayedItem.title: This protocol is recommended for reporting noninvasive urothelial tumors (papillary and flat), but it is not required for accreditation purposes.

Question.name: Q_14232
Question.title: Lymphatic and / or Vascular Invasion (Note E)

Question.name: Q_868389
Question.title: Treatment Effect Post Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy (BCG not included)

ListItem.name: LI_868391
ListItem.title: Complete response: the absence of histologically identifiable residual cancer cells and extensive fibrosis of the tumor bed after presurgical neoadjuvant therapy (TRG1)

ListItem.name: LI_868392
ListItem.title: Strong response: predominant fibrosis of the tumor bed with residual cancer cells occupying less than 50% of this area (TRG2)

ListItem.name: LI_868393
ListItem.title: Weak and no response: residual cancer cells occupying greater than or equal to 50% of the tumor bed or absence of regressive changes (TRG3)

ListItem.name: LI_365847
ListItem.title: All margins negative for invasive tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_52653
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_52653_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_327773
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Extravesical tumor directly invades any of the following: prostatic stroma, seminal vesicles, uterus, vagina, pelvic wall, abdominal wall
